results.title: ARTV
results.brief_description:
The Australian Centre for the Moving Image and SBS Independent will commission 16 artists to produce works for ARTV, an exhibition program which will be broadcast on SBS and shown on screens throughout ACMI concurrently, commencing on 8 June 2004.

ARTV is part of 2004, a survey exhibition of contemporary Australian visual culture presented by the Australian Centre for the Moving Image and the National Gallery of Victoria.
results.description:
The Australian Centre for the Moving Image and SBS Independent will commission 16 artists to produce works for ARTV, an exhibition program which will be broadcast on SBS and shown on screens throughout ACMI concurrently, commencing on 8 June 2004.

description_for_label:

ARTV is part of 2004, a survey exhibition of contemporary Australian visual culture presented by the Australian Centre for the Moving Image and the National Gallery of Victoria.

results.title: Whitefellanormal
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Vernon Ah Kee
results.brief_description: Vernon Ah Kee’s seething representation of contemporary Australian black/white politics playfully uses language, moving text and self-portraiture to deadly serious effect.
results.creator_credit_for_label: SBS Independent, ACMI and Vernon Ah Kee
results.description: Vernon Ah Kee’s seething representation of contemporary Australian black/white politics playfully uses language, moving text and self-portraiture to deadly serious effect.
description_for_label: Vernon Ah Kee’s seething representation of contemporary Australian black/white politics playfully uses language, moving text and self-portraiture to deadly serious effect.

results.title: Vessel
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Simryn Gill
results.brief_description: Simryn Gill’s languid mini-series stills the television screen, her camera framing a simple fishing boat and its passage, in real time, across the horizon.
results.description: Simryn Gill’s languid mini-series stills the television screen, her camera framing a simple fishing boat and its passage, in real time, across the horizon.
description_for_label: Simryn Gill’s languid mini-series stills the television screen, her camera framing a simple fishing boat and its passage, in real time, across the horizon.

results.title: Snap!
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Arlene TextaQueen
results.brief_description: Arlene TextaQueen’s saucy Textanudes deck of cards comes to life with a snap and a twist in this engaging mix of live action and animation.
results.description: Arlene TextaQueen’s saucy Textanudes deck of cards comes to life with a snap and a twist in this engaging mix of live action and animation.
description_for_label: Arlene TextaQueen’s saucy Textanudes deck of cards comes to life with a snap and a twist in this engaging mix of live action and animation.

results.title: Short band video
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Daniel von Sturmer
results.brief_description: Continuing from his ‘Truth Effect’ series, and the tradition of George Méliès, Daniel von Sturmer creates a miniature environment in which an everyday object behaves in unexpected ways.
results.creator_credit_for_label: SBS Independent, ACMI and Daniel von Sturmer
results.description: Continuing from his ‘Truth Effect’ series, and the tradition of George Méliès, Daniel von Sturmer creates a miniature environment in which an everyday object behaves in unexpected ways.

results.title: Paper War
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Guan Wei
results.brief_description: This simple tracking shot along Guan Wei’s exquisitely drawn battle scenes, silhouetted against a traditional landscape scroll, suggests the right-to-left movement of Chinese reading.
results.description: This simple tracking shot along Guan Wei’s exquisitely drawn battle scenes, silhouetted against a traditional landscape scroll, suggests the right-to-left movement of Chinese reading.
description_for_label: This simple tracking shot along Guan Wei’s exquisitely drawn battle scenes, silhouetted against a traditional landscape scroll, suggests the right-to-left movement of Chinese reading.

results.title: OverDrawn
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Martin Walch
results.brief_description: Martin Walch mixes the toxic beauty of his own photographs with industrial and geographic documentation in this animated pan across an area of the Mt Lyell mine, Tasmania.
results.description: Martin Walch mixes the toxic beauty of his own photographs with industrial and geographic documentation in this animated pan across an area of the Mt Lyell mine, Tasmania.
description_for_label: Martin Walch mixes the toxic beauty of his own photographs with industrial and geographic documentation in this animated pan across an area of the Mt Lyell mine, Tasmania.

results.title: Ost offic
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Helen Grace
results.brief_description: Helen Grace reworks images of a disused rural post office and repurposes found footage in this poetic meditation on the fragility of civic space.
results.description: Helen Grace reworks images of a disused rural post office and repurposes found footage in this poetic meditation on the fragility of civic space.
description_for_label: Helen Grace reworks images of a disused rural post office and repurposes found footage in this poetic meditation on the fragility of civic space.

results.title: Knit-face
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Janet Merewether
results.brief_description: Janet Merewether’s comic portrait series of knitted dolls illuminates the unpredictable, shabby beauty of found objects and gleefully appreciates the individual, creative application of this traditional craft form.
results.description: Janet Merewether’s comic portrait series of knitted dolls illuminates the unpredictable, shabby beauty of found objects and gleefully appreciates the individual, creative application of this traditional craft form.

results.title: From the heart
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Hossein Valamanesh
results.brief_description: Using 35mm footage capturing his own angiogram, Hossein Valamanesh creates a mysterious, luminescent universe which hovers, like a heartbeat, between biology and the sublime.
results.description: Using 35mm footage capturing his own angiogram, Hossein Valamanesh creates a mysterious, luminescent universe which hovers, like a heartbeat, between biology and the sublime.
